pageProps.content:
Experience

Meno a Kwena boasts a spectacular location on the Boteti River overlooking the Makgadikgadi Pans National Park – a completely contrasting location to the green & lush Okavango Delta region.
The zebra migration is resident here for much of the year, & in the dry season there is no other water around, so the Boteti River becomes the magnet for wildlife.

Stay

There are 8 double safari tents at Meno a Kwena, 6 of which are twin tents & 2 are king tents. Each twin tent is equipped with an indoor & outdoor shower, whereas the king tents all have outdoor showers.
Meno a Kwena also has 2 family tents. One of them accommodates a family of 5 with 1 king bed & 3 single beds. The second family tent can accommodate a family of 4, with 1 king bed & 2 single beds. Each tent is en-suite with indoor & outdoor showers.

Activities

Walking safaris with Bushmen from the Ju! Hoansi clan are immensely interesting since guests can learn about their hunter-gatherer way of life as they have coexisted with wildlife for many years. This gentle walk appeals to all ages.
The popular Pans-Sleep-Out is the adventure of a lifetime! This unique safari experience will take your breath away as you fall asleep under the African skies.
A 2-hour boat cruise along the Boteti River is ideal for bird lovers & there is a photographic hide on the water that offers a new perspective to wildlife in & around the river.
Guests can also enjoy open 4x4 game drives within the Makgadikgadi Pans National Park.

subfolders.title: Camp Kalahari
subfolders.description: Camp Kalahari is an authentic tented safari camp, located in the magnificent Makgadikgadi Pans area of Botswana. Camp Kalahari offers travellers a more affordable alternative to its luxurious sister camps:  Jack’s Camp & San Camp.  The best time to visit is during the wet season when guests will have a good opportunity to see the zebra & wildebeest migration as well as flamingos in their hundreds.

subfolders.title: Jack's Camp
subfolders.description: Jack’s Camp, an authentic & luxurious camp is set in a private concession on the border of the Makgadikgadi Pans of Botswana. Surrounded by desert & salt pans, Jack’s Camp provides a unique safari experience that cannot be found anywhere else in the country.  It is the only camp in Africa with a swimming pool tent, & one of a few that offers exciting Meerkat encounters.

subfolders.title: Leroo La Tau
subfolders.description: Leroo La Tau is situated in the Makgadikgadi Pans National Park.  Raised majestically above the Boteti River, guests have an opportunity to view the bush from an elevated platform, allowing for unobstructed views of Africa’s wildlife. The park, populated by up to 30,000 zebra and wildebeest closely accompanied by predators, offers guests the chance to experience the exhilaration of seeing large concentrations of game & the resultant predator interaction.

subfolders.title: Meno A Kwena
subfolders.description: Meno a Kwena boasts a spectacular location on the Boteti River overlooking the Makgadikgadi Pans National Park – a completely contrasting location to the green & lush Okavango Delta region. The zebra migration is resident here for much of the year, & in the dry season there is no other water around, so the Boteti River becomes the magnet for wildlife.

subfolders.title: Nxai Pan Camp
subfolders.description: Nxai Pan Camp is located in the wildlife-rich Nxai Pan National Park, a unique reserve encompassing a fossilized lakebed & the famous Baines’ Baobabs. Here, in the remote corners of Botswana, a unique mix of savannah & Kalahari species can be found.  The biggest draw to the park is during summer when zebras migrate by the thousands to the area to drop their young – the second-largest land animal migration in Southern Africa.

subfolders.title: San Camp
subfolders.description: San Camp, a romantic & luxurious desert camp is set in a private concession on the border of the Makgadikgadi Pans of Botswana. With only the desert & salt pans as a backdrop, San Camp provides an opportunity for guests to get away from it all & enjoy the solitude & tranquillity that can only be found in the desert.

whatWeLoveItems: Watch wildlife from the comfort of your private veranda
Encounter the zebra migration during the dry season
Enjoy a wide range of thrilling safari activities
